commits.message: add quick-fix for unnecessary operator is
fix review warnings; fix a bug
add utility class for type chekcking methods
add constants for is and whereType names
refactoring: move a castTypeInHierarchy to TypeCast class

Merge pull request #46 from xvadim/feature/avoid-unnecessary-type-assertions

Feature/avoid unnecessary type assertions

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,54 @@
+part of 'avoid_unnecessary_type_assertions_rule.dart';
+
+/// A Quick fix for `avoid-unnecessary-type-assertions` rule
+/// Suggests to remove unnecessary assertions
+class _UnnecessaryTypeAssertionsFix extends DartFix {
+  @override
+  void run(
+    CustomLintResolver resolver,
+    ChangeReporter reporter,
+    CustomLintContext context,
+    AnalysisError analysisError,
+    List<AnalysisError> others,
+  ) {
+    context.registry.addIsExpression((node) {
+      // checks that the literal declaration is where our warning is located
+      if (!analysisError.sourceRange.intersects(node.sourceRange)) return;
+
+      final changeBuilder = reporter.createChangeBuilder(
+        message: "Remove unnecessary 'is'",
+        priority: 1,
+      );
+
+      final isOperatorOffset = node.isOperator.offset;
+      changeBuilder.addDartFileEdit((builder) {
+        builder.addDeletion(
+          SourceRange(
+            isOperatorOffset,
+            node.length - (isOperatorOffset - node.offset),
comment.body:
`isOperatorIsOffset` -- sounds confusing
`operatorIsOffset` would make me double-take too.
Maybe `typeCheckOperatorOffset`?

comment.body:
In the context of this lint, the typecast source and target are highly coupled.
In simple terms -- everywhere they go, they go together.

So if we're not using procedural/imperative style -- it looks a lot like a small struct. 

Some utility methods look like they would belong to this structure quite well -- anything that compares the two fields.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,54 @@
+part of 'avoid_unnecessary_type_assertions_rule.dart';
+
+/// A Quick fix for `avoid-unnecessary-type-assertions` rule
+/// Suggests to remove unnecessary assertions
+class _UnnecessaryTypeAssertionsFix extends DartFix {
+  @override
+  void run(
+    CustomLintResolver resolver,
+    ChangeReporter reporter,
+    CustomLintContext context,
+    AnalysisError analysisError,
+    List<AnalysisError> others,
+  ) {
+    context.registry.addIsExpression((node) {
+      // checks that the literal declaration is where our warning is located
+      if (!analysisError.sourceRange.intersects(node.sourceRange)) return;
+
+      final changeBuilder = reporter.createChangeBuilder(
+        message: "Remove unnecessary 'is'",
+        priority: 1,
+      );
+
+      final isOperatorOffset = node.isOperator.offset;
+      changeBuilder.addDartFileEdit((builder) {
+        builder.addDeletion(
+          SourceRange(
+            isOperatorOffset,
+            node.length - (isOperatorOffset - node.offset),
comment.body: BTW why is an integer variable named with a `isX` prefix?

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,54 @@
+part of 'avoid_unnecessary_type_assertions_rule.dart';
+
+/// A Quick fix for `avoid-unnecessary-type-assertions` rule
+/// Suggests to remove unnecessary assertions
+class _UnnecessaryTypeAssertionsFix extends DartFix {
+  @override
+  void run(
+    CustomLintResolver resolver,
+    ChangeReporter reporter,
+    CustomLintContext context,
+    AnalysisError analysisError,
+    List<AnalysisError> others,
+  ) {
+    context.registry.addIsExpression((node) {
+      // checks that the literal declaration is where our warning is located
+      if (!analysisError.sourceRange.intersects(node.sourceRange)) return;
+
+      final changeBuilder = reporter.createChangeBuilder(
+        message: "Remove unnecessary 'is'",
+        priority: 1,
+      );
+
+      final isOperatorOffset = node.isOperator.offset;
+      changeBuilder.addDartFileEdit((builder) {
+        builder.addDeletion(
+          SourceRange(
+            isOperatorOffset,
+            node.length - (isOperatorOffset - node.offset),
comment.body:
Ah, right -- the grouping alters the sign of operation. So `a - (b - c)` -> `a + -(b + (-c))` -> `a + ((-b) - (-c))` -> `a + (- b + c)` -> `a - b + c`.

```suggestion
            node.length - isOperatorOffset + node.offset,
```

comment.body:
All subclasses of Iterable are also Iterable.
```suggestion
bool isIterable(DartType? type) =>
    _checkSelfOrSupertypes(type, (t) => t?.isDartCoreIterable ?? false);
```
